titleStmt.title: S. Jermane et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4948

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thos. E. Bramlette Governor of Kentucky
The undersigned Petitioners represent that two females named Anna Tennant and Eliza Graham are now confined in the Kentucky Penitentiary.
The time of Anna Tennant will expire the last of June 1864. The time of Eliza Graham will expire in the fall of 1864. She is exceedinlgy delicate and is unable to do any work of value
Both of these persons have professed Christianity and in believe that They will Deport themselves in a moral and upright manner hereafter if they are pardoned by your Excellency
We therefore pray your Excellency to pardon the Said persons

May 10. 1864
Mr. S. Jermane. Pastor Bapt Church.

Officers of Prison
R. W. Lawler. Keeper. asst.
R W Wilhoit M. D. Hospital
Ellias Jeffries- asst keeper-
E Whitesides asst keeper.
J. N. Markham
Tho Rodman
G. W. Gwin
John R Graham
Henry J Sheets
K. Rennjaw
As these women Show evidence of repentence I think it would be much better for them to be discharged from prison

H I Todd
Keeper of Penitentary

S Petition for the release
of Anna Tennant
&
Eliza GrahamEliza Graham

Felony 2 Years Jefferson County August ^Novr.^ 4th 1862
Nov. 4th 1864 time Expires
Nancy A Tennant stealing wearing apparrel one year. Kenton County June 29th 1863 Time Expires June 29th 1864-
